bwwExcerpt: by Ben Brantley) says: "Discovering how Margie operates - and where she's coming from - is one of the more subtly surprising treats of this theater season...Whether it's Ms. Parsons's amiably avaricious landlady or Ms. Goldsberry's reflexively compassionate suburbanite, there's nothing pure about the goodness or badness of the folks who inhabit this play. This makes them among the most fully human residents of Broadway these days."
